instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2485: What is A2485? A2485 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3651, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02100, 820-02382..
definitions.820-02100: What is 820-02100? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged 5V 0.03A
threads.message:
Not turning on, a liquid around UF500, opposite side of <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>, underneath <CHIP>U5000</CHIP>
Corroded and knocked off <RESISTOR>R8170</RESISTOR>, replaced it.

<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_AON</SIGNAL> - 5,19V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> - 12.9V
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL> - 3.79V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S2_MAIN</SIGNAL> - Jumping voltage at about 2.5V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE</SIGNAL> - Jumping too under 1V


I dont see any liquid around UC260. Its output is oscillating. Shall I replace or is there an easy way to cut off its output from the rest of the schematic and test if oscillating in case it is affected by the rest of the line?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged 5V 0.03A
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged 5V 0.03A
threads.message:
I can confirm that <SIGNAL>P5VS2TPS_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is also oscillating
<SIGNAL>P5VS2_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> too is oscillating
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AON</SIGNAL> - 1.79V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged 5V 0.03A
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE</SIGNAL> - Jumping too under 1V"
Still jumping with RC260 removed?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged 5V 0.03A
threads.message:
yes jumping at around 0.2-0.3V with removed RC260.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S2_MAIN</SIGNAL> - 0V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged 5V 0.03A
threads.message:
Then the problem is before of <SIGNAL>5V_S2</SIGNAL> appearance.

Check all LDOs of <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>.
